title: How to address a letter to a person living with others - Quora

response.answer_text: You can address the envelope: (Name of the person)c/o Name of the institution or family where the person residesaddress c/o is short for IN CARE OF and signifies that the letter is intended for the person but is being sent to the address with the expectation that the letter will be handed (usually unopened) to the person you want to receive it.
If your friend John Smith is staying with the Martins, the envelope could read : Mr. John Smith c/o Mr. and Mrs. Martin (c/o stands for : care of, in the care of)
